General course objectives:
General course objectives
To give students experience in to performing all aspects of an experimental or theoretical project without knowing the results beforehand.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Find and select relevant literature.
Search and obtain additional information from researchers/PhD students working in relevant fields.
Limit the field of interest based on objective and professional criteria, including arguing for new ideas related to the topic and relate the projects objective to existing research in the field.
Formulate aims and methods for the project that are suitable in both scope and complexity.
Explain core concepts within the project topic e.g. basic optical principles used in an application.
Set up realistic work- and time-plan and adjust this plan to encompass changes in the project.
Perform sober and systematic work within the project, e.g. by building one's own experimental setup / coding a simulation / acquiring measured or simulated data / treat data.
Relate achieved results obtained during the project to the end goal of project and adjust the project during the project period in accordance with the results achieved during the project period.
Interpret, judge and sum up the results, and present results by means of suitable figures, graphs and tables.
Write a well-structured and well-documented report and present the project and obtained results to fellow students.
Content: Projecs with relation to the research activities at the Department of Photonics engineering are offered, and the students choose among these.
Remarks: Student will be able to carry out projects at other departments under the assumption that the project and supervisor is approved by the coordinator of the MSc Photonics study line.
